etymology.description: 湛 (deep; clear) + 江 (river) = Zhanjiang; literally “deep/clear river.”
etymology.interpretation: A toponym built from morphemes meaning “deep/clear” and “river,” evoking a clear, deep waterway. As a city name, it highlights the locale’s close connection to rivers and the sea in southwestern Guangdong.

examples.chinese: 我打算去湛江旅行(我打算去湛江旅行)。
examples.english: I plan to travel to Zhanjiang.

examples.chinese: 湛江的海鲜很有名(湛江的海鮮很有名)。
examples.english: The seafood in Zhanjiang is very famous.

examples.chinese: 名字里“湛”有深而清的意思，“江”指河流(名字裡「湛」有深而清的意思，「江」指河流)。
examples.pinyin: Míngzi lǐ “zhàn” yǒu shēn ér qīng de yìsi, “jiāng” zhǐ héliú.
examples.english: In the name, “湛” conveys the sense of deep and clear, and “江” means river.
